langsim.utils.spsim.stringology module¶

Stringology

Utility functions, adapted from official release of SpSim.

ed(s1, s2)[source]¶

edit distance

>>> ed('', ''), ed('a', 'a'), ed('','a'), ed('a', ''), ed('a!a', 'a.a')
(0, 0, 1, 1, 1)

This implementation takes only O(min(|s1|,|s2|)) space.

ned(s1, s2)[source]¶
edsim(s1, s2)[source]¶
align(s1, s2, gap=' ')[source]¶

aligns two strings

>>> print u"\n".join(align('pharmacy', 'farmácia', gap='_'))
pharmac_y
_farmácia

>>> print u"\n".join(align('advantage', 'vantagem', gap='_'))
advantage_
__vantagem
mismatches(s1, s2, context=0)[source]¶

extract mismatched segments from aligned strings

>>> list(mismatches(*align('pharmacy', 'farmácia'), context=1))
[('pha', ' fa'), ('mac', 'mác'), ('c y', 'cia')]

>>> list(mismatches(*align('constitution', 'constituição'), context=1))
[('ution', 'uição')]

>>> list(mismatches(*align('idea', 'ideia'), context=1))
[('e a', 'eia')]

>>> list(mismatches(*align('instructed', 'instruído'), context=1))
[('ucted', 'u ído')]

>>> list(mismatches(*align('concluded', 'concluído'), context=1))
[('uded', 'uído')]
llcs(s1, s2)[source]¶

length of the longest common sequence

This implementation takes O(len(s1) * len(s2)) time and O(min(len(s1), len(s2))) space.

Use only with short strings.

>>> llcs('a.b.cd','!a!b!c!!!d!')
4
lcsr(s1, s2)[source]¶

lcs ratio (0 <= lcsr(s1, s2) <= 1)

lcp(s1, s2)[source]¶

longest common prefix

>>> lcp('abcdx', 'abcdy'), lcp('', 'a'), lcp('x', 'yz')
(4, 0, 0)
